ygData.subject: RE: Zoning Errors (RE:
ygData.msgSnippet: A similar thing happened to me a couple weeks ago at Unrest...I was zoning into Cauldron from Unrest with a 5 mob train on my tail...I thought I was a goner as
ygData.messageBody:
A similar thing happened to me a couple weeks ago at Unrest...I was zoning
into Cauldron from Unrest with a 5 mob train on my tail...I thought I was a
goner as I hit the zone with 1/4 bubble of health and was dropped back to my
windows desktop instead of the Cauldron corridor.

Frantically I reloaded EQ and clicked login, E'ci Server, blah blah, and
appeared INSIDE Unrest about 20 yards from the zone line with full health
and all my possessions, and no monsters anywhere to be found. Whew!

Faras "you have become better at luck (40)" Tar'Linedhel

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Blair, Keith (Keith Blair) [mailto:kblair@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, August 24, 1999 1:31 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: RE: Zoning Errors (RE: [eqbards] Frustration Story
> (OT - Long))
>
>
> From: "Blair, Keith (Keith Blair)" <kblair@...>
>
> > >Want to hear something really bizarre? I was
> > >going through the zone to enter the Keep in
> > >Highpass and when I got through the zone, I
> > >was at the zone border that goes from Kithicor
> > >to Highpass instead of inside the Keep zone. Woops.
> >
> > Ya got hit with an undocumented feature
> > him back to his last save point."
>
> The thing is, I didn't die nor was I being attacked
> or chased. I was a few bubbles down on health due to
> a previous fight (that ended) and when I rezoned in
> the wrong place I was at full health. So that was
> nifty at least - but at the time of hitting the zone,
> I was nowhere near death and again, not being attacked.
>
